source.author: Wilson, K.L.
source.title: Cyperaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Wilson, K.L. (1994). Cyperaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Nut distinctly longitudinally striate and transversely trabeculate; leaves with ligule of hairs or occasionally absent
Nut smooth, minutely reticulate, or tuberculate; leaves without ligule
Base of style glabrous or with short spreading hairs, not covering the upper part of the nut if present
Base of style with long deflexed hairs, at least partially covering the upper part of the nut
